metadata.title: Journal Pre-proof Applications of google search trends for risk communication in infectious disease management: A case study of COVID-19 outbreak in Taiwan Applications of Google Search Trends for Risk Communication in Infectious Disease Management: a Case Study of COVID-19 Outbreak in Taiwan

abstract.original_text:  Searches related to COVID-19 and face masks in Taiwan increased rapidly, following the announcements of Taiwan' first imported case and reached its peak as local cases were reported.  Searches for handwashing were gradually increased in period of face masks shortage in Taiwan.  Google Trends provides information on the most common knowledge needed by users and location of searches.  In response to the ongoing outbreak, our results demonstrated that Google Trends could potentially define the proper timing and location for practicing appropriate risk communication strategies to the affected population.
